body:
@indiemusicboy please fill out the correct template that is linked when opening a new issue

@karlitschek

could you also upload a file that only contains:

<?php
phpinfo();
?>

and check if there is something about safe mode in the browser if you open the file in the browser?
@deepdiver1975

@raydiation - i'm sorry but my knowledge is limited on some of these items. let me know what you need dire.

### expected behaviour
tell us what should happen: i'm assuming owncloud setup should continue forward.

### actual behaviour
tell us what happens instead: i get a "dependencies not found. php safe mode is enabled. owncloud requires that it is disabled to work properly." error

### steps to reproduce
1. contacted host to verify php safe mode is off
2. 
3. 

### server configuration
operating system: windows
microsoft asp.net support

web server: 

database:

php version:
5.3.21

owncloud version:
4.5.7

### client configuration
browser: safari

operating system:
x lion 10.7.5

### logs
#### web server error log
```
insert your webserver log here
```

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
insert your owncloud log here
```

#### browser log
```
insert your browser log here, this could for example include:

a) the javascript console log
b) the network log 
c) ...

windows server is supported only in oc5+
and we need the output of phpinfo() as requested above https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/2258#issuecomment-14788619

@deepdiver1975 but i only see oc 4.5.7: https://owncloud.org/support/install/

and as for #2258 i created a test.php and test.html file with that code. the php file gives me the referenced 500 error. the html file is just blank:

http://projects.miscomputer.com/cloud/test.html
http://projects.miscomputer.com/cloud/test.php

> but i only see oc 4.5.7: https://owncloud.org/support/install/

stay tuned! ;-)



>  the php file gives me the referenced 500 error. 

well - you need to double check the server logs.

please post your php.ini if possible

here is the server log for that subdomain. i don't see a php.ini as an option under the logs.

the php.ini is within your php installation folder

this is a windows server so i'm being told that's not possible. 

i'm being told that any errors should appear in the log i gave you.

should i just give up on this version? i could buy a linux version from my host unless i can start trying to install ver5 as a tester now.
try oc 5.0. if you want stability go for a linux distro though, there are some windows server only bugs atm
@raydiation i'd be happy to contribute to bugs. can you pass me the link to download and install oc 5?
release will be on thursday but you can also grab the dev version: http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/app/gettingstarted.html

maybe our check on safe mode needs some more love:
https://mantis.phplist.com/view.php?id=15273
````
  if (((strtolower(@ini_get('safe_mode')) == 'on') ||
  (strtolower(@ini_get('safe_mode')) == 'yes') ||
  (strtolower(@ini_get('safe_mode')) == 'true') ||
  (ini_get("safe_mode") == 1 )) && warn_about_php_settings)
````
or
http://phplist.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/phplist/branches/phplist-version-2-10-x/phplist/public_html/lists/admin/index.php?view=markup&pathrev=2680

@bartv2 @karlitschek ideas?

@indiemusicboy 
try to disable the check in lib/util.php 281

@deepdiver1975 that worked! but now i'm at the subdirectory creation and i get the following error when trying to create:
![screen shot 2013-03-14 at 11 08 31 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3844549/259621/465e8bce-8cc2-11e2-923e-1cba680fe064.png)

500 - internal server error.
there is a problem with the resource you are looking for, and it cannot be displayed.

i've enabled all read/write functionality across the board (see below) for the folder the php is in. that directory is site1/cloud/setup-owncloud.php

![screen shot 2013-03-14 at 11 12 58 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3844549/259619/3dfef0b8-8cc2-11e2-9fb7-7e7ef172f695.png)

@deepdiver1975 perhaps i'm installing in the wrong place to begin with. domain and host is miscomputer.com

i'm creating a subdomain of projects.miscomputer.com - where i'll beta owncloud for sharing project information with clients.

that subdomain points to the folder 'site1'

therefore my current path is //site1/cloud/setup-owncloud.php or projects.miscomputer.com/cloud/setup-owncloud.php

is this not correct protocol?

team: disregard. this is a shared server so i don't have access to the etc folder. this is probably the problem.

i talked to my host (sectorlink) and we are on a windows server. i guess this is the problem all around. too bad. this was going to be a big deal for us to use this for our projects nationwide.

i'm sorry to say, but i have no clue how your hosting environment is working - this is beyond the skills of us community members.

feel free to get in touch with the guys at www.owncloud.com for commercial support.

all the best - tom
